sourcesContent:
import React, {Component} from 'react'; import Header from "../containers/Header"; export default class TopMid extends Component { render(){ return (
Hyemi Song is a researcher and a designer interested in topics related to ‘data, communication, and human ’ in complex systems. Her academic research areas include information visualization, human-computer interaction, and visual analytics.

Currently, Hyemi is pursuing a Ph.D. in   Computer Science at the University of Maryland, College Park.   Previously, she was a research fellow, as a Data Visualization Specialist at   MIT Senseable City Lab.   Prior to this, she received an MFA from   Rhode Island School of Design.  

As a data visualization and UX/UI designer, Hyemi has worked with several international companies and institutions, such as Microsoft, Naver, Samsung, Korea Telecom, RISD, MIT and more. There, she participated in diverse product designs and developments for in the areas of AI and Machine Learning, Social Media, Mobile Operating System and Application, Search Engine, and Data Visualization.

Hyemi’s personal and commercial works have been featured in international awards, media, and exhibitions. These include Information is Beautiful Awards, IEEE Arts Program, Fast Company, Monthly Design Magazine, iF Design Awards, The Guardian, IdN, American Graphic Design Awards (GDUSA), Data Vis Today, Raw Data: Infographic Designers' Sketchbooks, Visualising Data, Visual Loop, Adobe Design Achievement Awards, Good Design Award, Seoul Design Olympiad, RISD Museum, De Young Museum, Internet Festival at Pisa, Hebei Design Center, MOOD Museum of Design among others.

At the   Bohyemian Lab,   Hyemi conducts design research projects focusing on data-driven self-expression through walking, reading, and more. Previous art & design projects are also archived on this website   https://bohyemian.com/.

She helps competitions and conferences as a jouror or a program comittee: the PacificVis (2022), the IEEE VIS Arts Program (2018~Present), the A'Design Award & Competition (2017~Present), and the 2018 Apexart exhibition.
) } }
